description: Lymphomatoid Papulosis is a rare skin condition characterized by the development of small, raised bumps on the skin. These papules may resemble insect bites and can vary in size and color. The condition is considered a type of cutaneous T-cell lymphoma, but it is generally benign and tends to resolve on its own over time.
possible causes: Possibly related to immune system dysfunction
symptoms: Small, red or purple bumps on the skin
Itching or tenderness in affected areas
Lesions that may come and go
treatments: Phototherapy or systemic medications in severe cases
